channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: What should ordinary investors know about 'comparative advantage'?
item.description: When we stroll down the aisles of our local supermarket, pause to browse electronics, or flip through streaming services at home, we seldom stop to think about how seamlessly international cultures and products have become part of our daily lives. Globalization – the process of international integration arising from interchange of world views, products, ideas, and cultural nuances – has quietly reshaped how we live, eat, entertain ourselves, and communicate.

item.title: Sarasota-based Dickinson & Gibbons attorneys named Super Lawyers
item.description: Sarasota-basedDickinson & Gibbonslaw partnersDeborah J. Blue,Gary H. Larsen, andJeffrey D. Peairswere recently named Super Lawyers andJesse R. Butlerwas designated a Florida Rising Star byThomson Reuters.

item.title: Fly away! Breeze adds 19 new routes, including several from Florida
item.description: Sometimes you just need to get away. Even if where you are is where others head to when they want to get away.

item.title: Open kitchen shelves may look great, Marni says, but are they for you?
item.description: I know it’s tempting. You see those clean, uncluttered open shelves in kitchens, with their matching ceramic dishes, beautifully staged glassware, lots of negative space, and you think, “Why not? If my kitchen had open shelving, my belongings would look great, too! Plus, everything would be so easy to reach.”

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Killer set for execution 43 years after Bay County…
item.description: TALLAHASSEE — More than 43 years after Janet White was abducted from a Bay County insurance office and murdered, Gov. Ron DeSantis on Friday signed a death warrant for convicted killer Kayle Barrington Bates.

item.title: Free, self-serve Sarasota County sandbag locations open Saturday
item.description: Sarasota County is offering free, voluntary, self-service sandbag locations this Saturday, July 19, to help residents in protecting their homes and property from potential flooding as they prepare for storms this hurricane season.

item.title: Elite recruits at Booker ready to lead last state title run as group
item.description: For most programs, a 10-4 finish with a berth in the state semifinals would be a season to hang your laurels on. Back-to-back regional championships are especially difficult, and a feat most programs in the state have never and likely will never accomplish.
